---
title: "Sintaxe do R e Estruturas de Dados"
subtitle: "BO304"
author: "Felipe Melo"
date: "last-modified"
date-format: "long"
format:
  html:
    toc: true
---

Tempo aproximado: 70 min

## Objetivos de Aprendizagem

- Descrever os tipos de dados mais utilizados em R.
- Construir estruturas de dados para armazenar informações.

## Tipos de Dados

Variáveis podem conter valores de tipos específicos no R. Os seis **tipos de dados** utilizados pelo R incluem:

- `"numeric"` para valores numéricos.
- `"character"` para texto.
- `"integer"` para números inteiros (`2L`).
- `"logical"` para `TRUE` e `FALSE`.
- `"complex"` para números complexos.
- `"raw"` (não abordado).

| Tipo de Dado | Exemplos |
| ------------:|:-------------------------------:|
| Numeric      | 1, 1.5, 20, pi |
| Character    | "anytext", "5", "TRUE" |
| Integer      | 2L, 500L, -17L |
| Logical      | TRUE, FALSE, T, F |

## Estruturas de Dados

### Vetores

![vetor numérico](../img/vector2.png)
![vetor de caracteres](../img/vector1.png)
![vetor lógico](../img/vector5-logical.png)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
glengths <- c(4.6, 3000, 50000)
glengths
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1]     4.6  3000.0 50000.0
```


:::
:::



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
species <- c("ecoli", "human", "corn")
species
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "ecoli" "human" "corn" 
```


:::
:::



` 

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Correção
species <- c("ecoli", "human", "corn")
species
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "ecoli" "human" "corn" 
```


:::
:::


***
**Exercício**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
combined <- c(glengths, species)
combined
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "4.6"   "3000"  "50000" "ecoli" "human" "corn" 
```


:::
:::


***

### Fatores

![fatores](../img/factors_sm.png)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
expression <- c("low", "high", "medium", "high", "low", "medium", "high")
expression <- factor(expression)
expression
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] low    high   medium high   low    medium high  
Levels: high low medium
```


:::
:::


![fatores novos](../img/factors_new.png)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
samplegroup <- c(
  "CTL", "CTL", "CTL",
  "KO", "KO", "KO",
  "OE", "OE", "OE"
)
samplegroup <- factor(samplegroup)
samplegroup
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] CTL CTL CTL KO  KO  KO  OE  OE  OE 
Levels: CTL KO OE
```


:::
:::


### Matrizes

![matriz](../img/matrix.png)

### Data Frames

![dataframe](../img/dataframe.png)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
df <- data.frame(species, glengths)
df
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  species glengths
1   ecoli      4.6
2   human   3000.0
3    corn  50000.0
```


:::
:::



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
titles <- c("Catch-22", "Pride and Prejudice", "Nineteen Eighty Four")
pages <- c(453, 432, 328)
favorite_books <- data.frame(titles, pages)
favorite_books
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
                titles pages
1             Catch-22   453
2  Pride and Prejudice   432
3 Nineteen Eighty Four   328
```


:::
:::


### Listas

![lista](../img/list.png)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
number <- 5
list1 <- list(species, df, number)
list1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[[1]]
[1] "ecoli" "human" "corn" 

[[2]]
  species glengths
1   ecoli      4.6
2   human   3000.0
3    corn  50000.0

[[3]]
[1] 5
```


:::
:::



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
list2 <- list(species, glengths, number)
list2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[[1]]
[1] "ecoli" "human" "corn" 

[[2]]
[1]     4.6  3000.0 50000.0

[[3]]
[1] 5
```


:::
:::
